column4: how do i make my pc automatically start a screen session called torrents running rtorrent when i boot up?
how do i start a screen session running a program every time i boot up?
not if i can avoid it
i dont mind login, start, logout
: I believe you can set startup programs in the session tool in your system menu
: excuse me if I get one of the names wrong, I'm not on a *nix box at the moment
its a server box so it needs to be run on boot not on login :(
: using the cli effectivly, like making use of shell scripts, grep, etc
how would i go about piping the output to mencoder as a list of files on the end?
: I'm not familiar with mencoder's syntax, sorry
the last argument for the command i am running is a list of the jpeg files produced by the ls | sort -n command
: you could do something like: myprogram -argument $(ls | sort -n) , that will put all the results of the ls into the $( )
